meanings.definition: To look at or stare angrily
meanings.sent1: She scowed at him when he broke her favorite mug.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scowed at the students who were talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat scowed at the dog who tried to steal its food.
meanings.sent4: The old man scowed at the noisy neighbors from his porch.
meanings.sent5: The boss scowed at the employees who were late for the meeting.
